Apple___Apple_scab: Remove and destroy infected leaves and fruit. Improve airflow by thinning canopy. Apply recommended fungicide during leaf emergence and wet periods; follow label instructions.
Apple___Black_rot: Prune and remove mummified fruit and infected branches. Remove nearby wild hosts. Apply fungicide during growing season if disease pressure is high.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust: Remove nearby cedar/juniper hosts if feasible. Prune infected foliage and apply protective fungicide sprays during spore release periods.
Apple___healthy: Plant appears healthy. Maintain good practices: regular inspection, balanced fertilization, and proper irrigation.
Blueberry___healthy: Healthy. Maintain soil pH and avoid waterlogging. Monitor plants regularly for pests and disease signs.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew: Remove or trim affected shoots, improve airflow and reduce humidity. Use sulfur or recommended fungicides when necessary.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy: Healthy. Maintain pruning and sanitation; monitor during wet seasons.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray: Remove volunteer plants and crop debris. Use resistant hybrids when available and rotate crops. Fungicide sprays can help in severe epidemics.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_: Crop rotation and resistant varieties help. Fungicides may be used when economic thresholds are reached; consult local guidelines.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: Use resistant hybrids and rotate crops. Fungicide application may be needed for severe early infections.
Corn_(maize)___healthy: Healthy. Follow good crop management and monitor for leaf diseases during humid weather.
Grape___Black_rot: Remove and destroy infected fruit and canes. Prune to improve airflow. Apply fungicide during bloom and pre-harvest as recommended.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles): Remove severely infected wood and practice proper sanitation. Consider professional diagnosis for advanced cases; follow vineyard best practices.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo: Remove infected leaves and improve canopy ventilation. Apply recommended fungicide sprays during wet periods.
Grape___healthy: Healthy. Continue pruning, monitoring, and appropriate fungicide program if history indicates risk.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening): This is a serious bacterial disease spread by psyllids. Remove infected trees where required by local regulations. Control psyllid vectors and consult extension services for area-specific measures.
Peach___Bacterial_spot: Remove infected fruit and prune affected shoots. Use copper sprays during bloom or early season as recommended and use resistant cultivars if available.
Peach___healthy: Healthy. Maintain good orchard sanitation and monitor for bacterial and fungal symptoms.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot: Remove infected leaves and fruit; avoid overhead irrigation. Use drip irrigation and copper-based sprays if recommended. Practice crop rotation.
Pepper,_bell___healthy: Healthy. Continue sanitation and monitor for pests and bacterial symptoms.
Potato___Early_blight: Remove and destroy infected foliage; avoid dense planting. Apply recommended protectant fungicides early in the season on a spray schedule.
Potato___Late_blight: Late blight can be severe: remove infected plants, avoid spreading, and apply appropriate fungicides immediately. Consult local extension for resistant varieties and spray programs.
Potato___healthy: Healthy. Practice crop rotation and inspect tubers and foliage regularly.
Raspberry___healthy: Healthy. Maintain good air movement, prune canes properly, and monitor for cane and fruit diseases.
Soybean___healthy: Healthy. Rotate crops and monitor for foliar or root diseases especially in wet conditions.
Squash___Powdery_mildew: Remove and destroy heavily infected leaves. Improve airflow and apply sulfur or registered fungicides as needed; avoid overhead watering.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch: Remove and destroy severely infected leaves. Improve spacing and airflow. Control vectors and follow recommended chemical controls if necessary.
Strawberry___healthy: Healthy. Use good soil drainage, balanced nutrition and monitor for common strawberry pests and diseases.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Remove infected fruit and leaves. Avoid overhead irrigation and sanitize tools. Copper sprays may reduce spread; use disease-free transplants.
Tomato___Early_blight: Remove infected debris and lower leaves. Apply protective fungicides and practice crop rotation and resistant varieties where available.
Tomato___Late_blight: This can spread rapidly — remove infected plants, improve spacing, and apply fungicides promptly. Avoid moving wet plant material between fields.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Remove lower leaves and improve airflow in greenhouse production. Apply fungicides labeled for leaf mold and avoid humid conditions.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Remove infected lower foliage and avoid overhead watering. Apply fungicides where necessary and rotate crops.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider: Control mites with targeted miticides or biological controls. Reduce dust and avoid plant stress; inspect underside of leaves and act early.
Tomato___Target_Spot: Remove infected debris and apply fungicide treatments as recommended. Maintain good irrigation practices and crop sanitation.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: This is a viral disease spread by whiteflies. Remove infected plants and control whitefly vectors. Use resistant varieties where available.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: Virus spread by contact — remove infected plants, sanitize tools and hands. Use certified seed and resistant varieties if possible.
Tomato___healthy: Healthy. Keep consistent watering, proper nutrition, and monitor regularly for pests and diseases.
